{{tt|last_spec}} is an empty tag type that is used in conjunction with other calendar types to indicate the last thing in a sequence. Depending on context, it may indicate the last day of a month (as in {{c|2018y/February/last}}, for last day of February 2018, i.e., 2018-02-28) or the last day of the week in a month (as in {{c|2018/February/Sunday[last]}}, for last Sunday of February 2018, i.e., 2018-02-25).

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;

int main()
{
    using namespace std::chrono;

    constexpr auto mdl {June/last};
    static_assert(mdl == month_day_last(month(6)));

    constexpr auto ymwdl {year(2023)/December/Tuesday[last]};
    static_assert(ymwdl ==
        year_month_weekday_last(year(2023), month(12), weekday_last(Tuesday)));
}
}}
